title: List of Iris species
text:
Subgenus "<a href="Iris%20subg.%20Iris">Iris</a>".
Bearded rhizomatous irises
Section "Iris"
Section "Oncocyclus"
Section "Hexapogon"
Section "Psammiris"
Section "Pseudoregelia"
Section "Regelia"
Subgenus "<a href="Iris%20subg.%20Limniris">Limniris</a>".
Beardless rhizomatous irises
It has been generally divided into 2 <a href="section%20%28biology%29">section</a>s, 'Limniris', which is further divided down to about 16 <a href="series%20%28botany%29">series</a> and 'Lophiris' (also known as 'Evansias' or crested iris.
Section "Limniris" (going in alphabetical order)
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Californicae">Californicae</a>" Pacific Coast irises 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Chinenses">Chinenses</a>" (from east Asia) 
"Series Ensatae" 
"Series Foetidissimae" 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Hexagonae">Hexagonae</a>" 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Laevigatae">Laevigatae</a>" 
(which includes the <a href="Japanese%20iris">Japanese iris</a>es) 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Longipetalae">Longipetalae</a>" 
(Rocky Mountain or long-petaled iris) 
"Series Prismaticae" 
(contains just one species from America) 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Ruthenicae">Ruthenicae</a>"
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Sibiricae">Sibiricae</a>"
(Siberian irises) 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Spuriae">Spuriae</a>"
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Syriacae">Syriacae</a>"
(species with swollen leaf bases and spiney bristles) 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Tenuifoliae">Tenuifoliae</a>"
(mostly semi-desert plants) 
"Series <a href="Iris%20ser.%20Tripetalae">Tripetalae</a>" 
(mostly having three petals) 
"Series Unguiculares"
"Series "Vernae"
(contains just one species from America) 
Section "Lophiris"
Section "Unguiculares"
Unplaced hybrids
Subgenus "<a href="Iris%20subg.%20Xiphium">Xiphium</a>".
Smooth-bulbed bulbous irises. Formerly genus "Xiphion".
Section "Xiphium"
Subgenus "<a href="Iris%20subg.%20Nepalensis">Nepalensis</a>".
Bulbous irises. Formerly genus "Junopsis".
Section "Nepalensis"
Subgenus "<a href="Iris%20subg.%20Scorpiris">Scorpiris</a>".
Smooth-bulbed bulbous irises known as "junos". Formerly genus "Juno".
Section "Scorpiris"
See more species listed in 'Scorpiris' subgenus.
Subgenus "<a href="Iris%20subg.%20Hermodactyloides">Hermodactyloides</a>".
Reticulate-bulbed bulbous irises. Formerly genus "Iridodictyum".
Section "Hermodactyloides"
